structure.description: Timeline MUST be returned as exact JSON with BOTH arrays

itemStructure.owner: enum - MUST be one of: 'WarmUp', 'Client', or 'WarmUp and Client'
itemStructure.weeks: string - MUST match format 'Week X–Y' or 'Weeks X–Y'

example.description: Buy domains, set mailboxes, warmup accounts…

itemStructure.weeks: string - MUST match format 'Week X–Y' or 'Weeks X–Y'
itemStructure.tasks: array of strings - short, action-led tasks

tasks: Kickoff meeting, system audit, confirm KPIs, finalize plan

totalRows.note: Combined total across workItems and phases arrays

validation.descriptionStyle: Concise, action-oriented, uses ellipsis (…) for continuation

mustInclude: owner field in each workItem (WarmUp, Client, or WarmUp and Client)
weeks field in proper format (Week X–Y or Weeks X–Y)
shouldAvoid: incorrect week format (using hyphen instead of en-dash)
missing either workItems or phases array
timeline.promptInstructions:
Return timeline in EXACT JSON with BOTH arrays:
- workItems: [{workItem, description, owner, weeks}]
- phases: [{phase, weeks, tasks[]}]

Rules:
- weeks must match "Week X–Y" or "Weeks X–Y"
- 6–10 rows total across both tables
- Owners use only: "WarmUp", "Client", or "WarmUp and Client"
- Tasks are short, action‑led

coverPageData.description: Order Form data displayed on cover page

fields.costPerMonth: number - monthly cost without currency symbol

shouldAvoid: currency symbols in costPerMonth (use number only)

tableOfContents.description: Table of contents with section titles and page numbers

items.title: string - section title
items.page: number or null (null in preview, PDF renderer fills)

keyPriorities.bulletStyle: concise, outcome-focused, starts with action verb or result
example: Generate 6-8 qualified leads per month through targeted outbound
Establish thought leadership via LinkedIn content strategy
Build scalable email infrastructure for long-term growth
Optimize campaign performance based on data-driven insights

nextSteps.description: 3-5 action items with optional owner and timeframe
example: Review and approve this proposal by March 15
Provide brand assets and messaging docs (Client, Week 1)
Begin domain and mailbox setup (WarmUp, Week 1)
Complete onboarding and launch first campaign (WarmUp, Weeks 2-3)

structure.commitment: string - commitment duration (optional, can be empty)

example.focus: Foundational projects with high ROI and operational efficiency
bullets: Customer Expansion: Identify top expansion opportunities within existing accounts. Enrich contact lists and segment outreach by department and location. Build automated email and task workflows in HubSpot.
Partner Campaigns: Segment partner accounts by type and value. Create tailored outreach sequences for each segment.
Lead Scoring: Implement lead scoring workflows in HubSpot. Create task triggers for high-priority leads.

example.focus: Expand successful campaigns and add new initiatives
bullets: Inbound Lead Optimization: Connect RB2B.com with Clay and HubSpot. Automate enrichment and task creation for inbound leads.
Job Change Monitoring: Monitor job changes for key decision-makers; automate personalized outreach on role changes.
